intro: Polybotrya appendiculata var. hamiltoniana, commonly known as the Hamilton's rock cress, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
